data.description: The scope of this document is to provide an architecture for the OMA presence service Enabler, which includes a general network-agnostic model, for mobile presence using the IETF SIMPLE specifications.
The scope of this document is limited to the Enabler Release Definition of the OMA Presence SIMPLE according to OMA Release process and the Enabler Release specification baseline listed in section 5.
This document contains use-cases and requirements for a Presence Service, taking into considerations the demands of end-users, service providers, and system implementers.

This document provides the specifications for the Presence Service enabler based on the IETF SIMPLE (SIP Instant Messaging and Presence Leveraging Extensions) technology.  This release of the specification supports the OMA PoC service enabler, and utilizes a SIP/IP core based on the 3GPP IMS and 3GPP2 MMD network capabilities.
The Resource List Server XDMS (RLS XDMS) specific data formats and XCAP application usages are described in this specification.
The Presence XDMS specific data formats and XCAP application usages are described in this specification.
